eyetools 0.5.0

    Sequence analysis of area of interest entries

    AOI_seq.Rd

    Analyses the sequence of entries into defined AOI regions across trials. Works with fixation data or raw data as the input.

    Usage

    AOI_seq(data, AOIs, AOI_names = NULL, sample_rate = NULL)

    Arguments

    data

    A dataframe with fixation data (from fix_dispersion) or raw data.

    AOIs

    A dataframe of areas of interest (AOIs), with one row per AOI (x, y, width_radius, height).

    AOI_names

    An optional vector of AOI names to replace the default "AOI_1", "AOI_2", etc.

    sample_rate

    Optional sample rate of the eye-tracker (Hz) for use with raw_data. If not supplied, the sample rate will be estimated from the time column and the number of samples.

    Value

    a dataframe containing the sequence of entries into AOIs on each trial

    Examples

    fix_d <- fix_dispersion(eyetools::example_raw_WM)
AOI_seq(fix_d, eyetools::AOIs_WM)
#>     trial AOI_entry_seq
#> 1       1   3;4;3;2;4;2
#> 2       2     4;3;1;2;4
#> 3       3     2;4;3;1;3
#> 4       4   1;2;4;3;1;4
#> 5       5     1;2;1;2;4
#> 6       6       2;4;2;1
